args:
Further in the ruins, the prince encounters his
brothers Phares and Emile. Together, they learn
about Alberius and Morsayati's battle that
occurred 300 years prior. But that knowledge
is only the beginning, so the brothers proceed
ever deeper into the ruins.
Emile?! Is that you?!\nAnd wait, is that...?
It has been some time, Brother.
Phares! How did the two of you come\nall this way without an escort?
The best attendant to deep thought\nis but perfect solitude.
And I DID bring guards, but the pathetic\nweaklings all got themselves killed\non the way down here!
Who do they think I AM, summoning me\ninto a festering scrap heap like this?!
Now I understand what Harle meant\nwhen he said he'd sent invitations.
Yes, I received one I couldn't well ignore.
It bade me come here to witness the\nOther—Morsayati—regain the strength\nhe possessed in ancient times.
He wrote that in a letter?!
EXCUSE me, but the invitation I received\nbore no mention of any such thing!
And I can hazard a guess as to why.\nHmm... It seems a part of this may\nyet be tied into my own research.
If you know something about this,\nBrother, I beg you to tell me.
I simply have doubts as to the accuracy\nof the tale that has been handed down.
Did Alberius TRULY seal away the Other?
What nonsense! We've had 300 years of\npeace precisely BECAUSE His Majesty\nKing Alberius sealed the Other away!
The concept of sealing the Other is hardly\nso inextricably linked to ＂peace.＂
On the contrary, those concepts are held\ntogether by the most gossamer of threads.
I ain't much for riddles, pal.\nWhat say ya start talkin' plain?
It is a danger to come so readily\nto a safe, tidy conclusion.
Fortunately, it seems the entirety of the\nmystery will be laid bare in this place,\nso let us press on to the truth together.
O memory of the king!\nBy the oath of our bloodline, awaken!
You foul, impertinent dragons!\nYou dare interfere with me again?!
The goddess has honored me with this\nholy blade, and I shall wield its power\nto bring about your ruination!
...No. I feel it. The villain yet lives!
Your intuition is sharp, hero.\nYou are a benefit to the name.
Be honored, mortal! You are the first to\nlook upon this form since Ilia herself!
If this is your true form, then I need\nbut to slay it in order to consign you\nto the dustbin of history!
I hail from another world; a being\nof pure, refined power itself.\nMy flesh is no more than a husk.
Strike at the vessel as you will, mortal.\nBrandish the blade to your heart's content.\nIt matters not, for my soul is inviolable!
Try as you might to seal me away,\nyou WILL know your place in the end!
Was that what truly happened\nduring the War of Binding?
King Alberius was unable to seal away\nthe Other? ...N-no! Impossible!
Heh... Aaaaah ha ha ha ha!
What a joke! The Founder King?\nMore like the FLOUNDER King!
That's your own ancestor you're\ntrashin' there, pal.
So what if he is?! I understand it now!\nI understand why you all refuse to\nacknowledge me!
You're just as incompetent as our ancestor,\nand you don't understand a person's worth!
Good to see you're as annoying as ever.
It seems he learned nothing at all\nfrom the incident at Saint Lotier.
We let him slide back then,\nbut this time I'm gonna—

You would raise a hand against me?!
Try it, then, if you think you are able—
you will see just how strong an opponent
you face!
In the form of my brother, Phares!
...Pray forgive him. I know his mouth\nruns like a mighty river, but in the end,\nhe is harmless as a meadow brook.
Family holidays must be MURDER\nat your place, {player_name}.
Tell me what you're thinking, Phares.
At this rate, all of Alberia will fall\nunder the control of the Other.
It will become an evil, chaotic empire\nwhose people suffer like no other.\nAre you truly willing to let that happen?
Good and evil hold no interest for me.
Fate will run whatever course it will.\nI seek only to watch and observe.
Are you truly so certain that a nation ruled\nby the Other would be a wicked one?
How can you even ask that?!
I suspect the answer to that question\nlies just ahead. Let us be off.
Phares still serves the Empire.\nWe can't possibly trust him!
If you're worried I'm here to capture you\nor relieve you of your heads, I was told\nnothing of the sort.
Maybe so, but who knows what schemes\nya got cookin'.
Our destination is likely one and the same,\nso there is no point in acting separately.\nHowever, I will not force your hand.
To think of a world ruled by the Other...
Brooding over it will get us nowhere,\nYour Highness.
You're right, Elly. Let's get moving.
